revision.comment: Adding local [[Wikipedia:Short description|short description]]: "2007 single by Justin Timberlake", overriding Wikidata description "song by Justin Timberlake" ([[Wikipedia:Shortdesc helper|Shortdesc helper]])
revision.text:
{{short description|2007 single by Justin Timberlake}} {{Infobox song | name = Summer Love | cover = JT Summer Love.png | alt = | border = yes | type = single | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | album = [[FutureSex/LoveSounds]] | A-side = [[Until the End of Time (Justin Timberlake and Beyoncé song)|Until the End of Time]] | released = {{Start date|2007|4|10}} | format = {{hlist|[[Compact Disc single|CD]]|[[Music download|digital download]]}} | recorded = 2005; [[Thomas Crown Studios]]
([[Virginia Beach, Virginia]]) | studio = | venue = | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] | length =6:24 (album version)
4:11 (radio edit) | label = {{hlist|[[Jive Records|Jive]]|[[Zomba Group of Companies|Zomba]]}} | writer = {{hlist|[[Justin Timberlake]]|Tim Mosley|Nate Hills}} | producer = {{hlist|[[Timbaland]]|[[Danja (record producer)|Danja]]|Justin Timberlake}} | prev_title = [[Until the End of Time (Justin Timberlake and Beyoncé song)|Until the End of Time]] | prev_year = 2007 | next_title = [[4 Minutes]] | next_year = 2008 }} "'''Summer Love'''" is a song by American singer [[Justin Timberlake]] from his second studio album ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]'' (2006). It was written and produced by Timberlake, Tim "[[Timbaland]]" Mosley and Nate "[[Danja (record producer)|Danja]]" Hills. "Summer Love" is a [[pop music|pop]] song about "wanting to fall in love with the lusty seasonal lover". Its instrumentation consists of keyboards, drums, guitars, pianos, and handclaps. "Summer Love" received generally positive reviews from music critics, with some comparing it to Timberlake's work with [[NSYNC]]. "Summer Love" reached number six on the US ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Billboard Hot 100|Hot 100]] and number one on the ''Billboard'' [[Pop Songs]] chart. It was certified platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) for selling over one million units. The song also peaked at the top ten in Belgium and Canada. "Summer Love" was included in the set list of Timberlake's second worldwide tour [[FutureSex/LoveShow]] in 2007.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/02/09/arts/music/09timb.html|title=Music Review – Justin Timberlake – He’s Bringing Commitment Back (and Not in a Box)|work=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|last=Michel|first=Sia|date=February 9, 2007|accessdate=June 1, 2012}} ==Production and release== When composing songs for his second studio album ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]'', Timberlake went to former ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' collaborator [[Timbaland]]'s studio in [[Virginia Beach, Virginia]], to begin sessions for his second album.{{Cite web|last=Vineyard|first=Jennifer|title=Road to the Grammys: Justin Wanted To Channel Coldplay On FutureSex/LoveSounds|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1552019/20070208/timberlake_justin.jhtml|publisher=[[MTV News]]. [[Viacom (2005–present)|Viacom]]|date=February 9, 2007|accessdate=May 30, 2012}} However, not one of them had an idea of what the album would be–no plan for it and even a title.{{Cite web|last=Vineyard|first=Jennifer|title=Justin Timberlake's Fooling 'Around' Resulted In Award-Nominated Song: Behind The Grammys|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1581045/20080206/timberlake_justin.jhtml|publisher=MTV News. Viacom|date=February 8, 2008|accessdate=May 30, 2012}} "Summer Love/Set the Mood (Prelude)" was written and produced by [[Timbaland|Timo "Timbaland" Mosley]], [[Danja (record producer)|Nate "Danja" Hills]] and Timberlake himself.{{cite web|url=http://www.ascap.com/ace/search.cfm?requesttimeout=300&mode=results&searchstr=493845775&search_in=i&search_type=exact&search_det=t,s,w,p,b,v&results_pp=25&start=1|title=Justin Timberlake – Summer Love|publisher=[[American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers]]|accessdate=May 30, 2012}} The song was recorded by Jimmy Douglas, while its mixing was done by Douglas together with Timbaland. The keyboards were provided by Timberlake, Timbaland and Danja; the latter also played the drums in the single. "Summer Love" was released as the sixth and final single from ''FutureSex/LoveSounds''. The song was remixed with additional vocals by American rapper [[Stat Quo]]. A reviewer of DJ Booth commented that the collaboration will "burn up the dance floors". He also stated that "the collaboration is chalked full of infectious production work from none other than Timbo [Timbaland]."{{cite web|url=http://www.djbooth.net/index/tracks/review/justin-timberlake-ft-stat-quo-summer-love-remix/|title=Justin Timberlake – Summer Love (Remix) ft. Stat Quo|publisher=DJ Booth|accessdate=May 30, 2012}} ==Composition== {{listen | filename = Justin Timberlake_-_Summer Love.ogg | title = "Summer Love" (2006) | description = A 19-second sample of the chorus of "Summer Love". Its instrumentation consists of keyboards, drums, guitar, piano and "[[Clapping|handclaping]]". | pos = right | format = [[Ogg]] }} "Summer Love" is an uptempo pop song, with a length of four minutes and thirteen seconds.{{cite web|url=http://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtdFPE.asp?ppn=MN0056582&|title=Justin Timberlake – Summer Love Sheet Music (Digital Download)|publisher=Musicnotes.com. [[Universal Music Publishing Group]]|accessdate=May 30, 2012}}{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2006/sep/08/popandrock.shopping8|title=CD: Justin Timberlake, FutureSex/LoveSounds|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=Guardian News and Media|last=Petridis|first=Alexis|date=September 8, 2006|accessdate=May 31, 2012}} According to digital sheet music published at Musinotes.com by [[Universal Music Publishing Group]], "Summer Love" was written in the key of [[D minor]], in common time with a moderately slow 96 beat-per-minute [[Tempo (music)|tempo]]. Timberlake's vocal range in the song spans from the low note of [[D (musical note)|D4]] to the high note of [[A (musical note)|A5]]. Its instrumentation consists of keyboards, drums, guitar, piano and handclaps. Barry Schwartz of ''[[Stylus Magazine]]'' praised the song and commented that "with its good foot hesitation boom-clap and cascading chorus synthline" 'Summer Love' shows Timberlake's best vocals on ''FutureSex/LoveSounds''." Schwartz further stated that "the beat drops out while he sings in perfect harmony, 'Tell me how they got that pretty little face on that pretty little frame girl'".{{cite web|url=http://www.stylusmagazine.com/reviews/justin-timberlake/futuresexlovesounds.htm|title=Justin Timberlake – FutureSex/LoveSounds|publisher=[[Stylus Magazine]]. Todd Burns|last=Schwartz|first=Barry|date=September 12, 2006|accessdate=May 30, 2012}} Lyrically, the single is about "wanting to fall in love with the lusty seasonal lover".{{cite web|url=http://northbynorthwestern.com/story/album-review-of-justin-timberlakes-futuresexloveso/|title=Album Review of Justin Timberlake's FutureSex/LoveSounds|publisher=[[North by Northwestern]]. [[Northwestern University]]|last= Salas|first=Dagny|date=October 9, 2006|accessdate=May 31, 2012}} ==Critical reception== [[File:Jtstpaul.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Justin Timberlake performing on his 2007 [[FutureSex/LoveShow]] tour.]] Critics reacted in a generally positive manner to "Summer Love". Barry Schwartz of Stylus Magazine gave "Summer Love" a positive review and additionally praised "its good foot hesitation boom-clap and cascading chorus". Alexis Petridis of ''[[The Guardian]]'' stated, "a dreary central-casting pop ballad called 'Summer Love' is enlivened only by another of Timberlake's peculiar announcements: 'I'm sick and tired of trying to save the world.' Shaheem Reid and Jayson Rodriguez off [[MTV News]] stated that "Summer Love" alongside Timberlake's 2007 singles "[[My Love (Justin Timberlake song)|My Love]]" and "[[LoveStoned]]", rocked every [[iPod]], stereo player and stadium during his [[FutureSex/LoveShow|tour]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1576858/t-pain-beyonce-more-our-fave-rb-acts-07.jhtml|title=T-Pain, Beyonce, Justin Timberlake And More Are Our Favorite R&B Acts Of 2007|publisher=MTV News. Viacom|author1=Shaheem Reid|author2=Jayson Rodriguez|date=December 20, 2007|accessdate=May 31, 2012}} [[North by Northwestern]]'s Dagny Salas called "Summer Love/Set the Mood (Interlude)" a stand-out track on ''FutureSex/LoveSounds''. According to him the song "oozes sun, sex, and a sultry affair". A reviewer of [[IGN]] commented that "the bulk of the album is focused on funk lite, but with 'Summer Love/Set The Mood (Prelude)' Timberlake and Timbaland slip into darkness."{{cite web|url=http://music.ign.com/articles/732/732876p1.html|title=Justin Timberlake – Futuresex/Lovesounds|publisher=[[IGN]]. [[News Corporation (1980–2013)|News Corporation]]|date=September 14, 2006|access-date=May 31, 2012|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/668mBr66Q?url=http://music.ign.com/articles/732/732876p1.html|archive-date=March 13, 2012|df=}} An editor of [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] criticized Timbaland's production: "[W]hile the track offers cunning instrumentation, Timbaland's heavy production hand is so overwhelming that the singer is pushed to the back of the track".{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2007/04/14/music-review-music-singles-dc-idUSN0627033720070414|title=Billboard single reviews: Timberlake, Snow Patrol|author=''Billboard''|publisher=[[Reuters]]. [[Thomson Reuters]]|accessdate=June 20, 2012}} ==Commercial performance== The song debuted at number 74 on the US ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Billboard Hot 100|Hot 100]] chart in the issue dated April 28, 2007.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/2007-04-28/hot-100?order=gainer|title=Hot 100 – Biggest Jump|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=June 1, 2012}} After seven weeks on the chart, on June 9, 2007, the single reached its peak at number six.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/2007-06-09/hot-100|title=Hot 100 – Biggest Jump|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|accessdate=June 1, 2012}} The next week it fell to number eight and stayed on the position for four weeks, before falling to number nine in the issue dated July 14, 2007.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/2007-07-14/hot-100|title=Hot 100 – Biggest Jump|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|accessdate=June 1, 2012}} "Summer Love" became Timberlakes's sixth single to reach the top ten and stayed a total of 20 weeks on the chart. It ranked at number 39 on ''Billboard'''s Best of 2007 – Hot 100 Songs. The single debuted on the US Pop Songs chart at number 39 in the issue dated April 21, 2007,{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/2007-04-21/pop-songs?order=gainer|title=Pop Songs – Biggest Jump|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|accessdate=June 1, 2012}} and peaked at number one on June 23, 2007. "Summer Love" became Timberlake's fifth number one single on the US Pop Songs chart. For the issue dated July 28, 2007, the song peaked at number 24 on the US [[Adult Pop Songs]] chart. It was certified platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) after one million downloads of the song were sold.{{cite web|url=http://riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpage=1&table=SEARCH_RESULTS&action=&title=&artist=Justin%20Timberlake&format=ALBUM&debutLP=&category=SOLO&sex=&releaseDate=&requestNo=&type=&level=&label=Jive&company=&certificationDate=&awardDescription=&catalogNo=&aSex=&rec_id=&charField=&gold=&platinum=&multiPlat=&level2=&certDate=&album=&id=&after=on&before=on&startMonth=6&endMonth=4&startYear=2002&endYear=2009&sort=Artist&perPage=25|title=Searchable Database|publisher=[[Recording Industry Association of America]]|access-date=May 30, 2012|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924151606/http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpage=1|archive-date=September 24, 2015|df=}} As of 2018, the song has sold 1.6 million copies in the country.{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8097976/justin-timberlake-nsync-career-album-song-sales-ask-billboard|title=Ask Billboard: Justin Timberlake & *NSYNC's Career Album & Song Sales |work=Billboard |publisher=Billboard-Hollywood Media Group |date=February 4, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018 |last=Trust |first=Gary}} "Summer Love" peaked at number eight on the [[Canadian Hot 100]] chart, for the issue dated June 30, 2007 and stayed on the chart for 16 weeks. Elsewhere, the song attained moderate success. In New Zealand, "Summer Love" debuted at number 35 on August 27, 2007. After thirteen weeks fluctuating on the chart it reached its peak of 15 on November 26, 2007. The song stayed on the chart for total of 19 weeks. In Europe, the single entered on six national charts. In Austria it debuted at number 52, and after two weeks the song peaked at number 47. It stayed on the chart for total of seven weeks. "Summer Love" was more successful in Belgium, where it reached number six on the [[Ultratop 50|Flandrian Singles Chart]] and number eight on the [[Ultratop 50|Wallonian Singles Chart]]. The single entered the [[Swedish Singles Chart]] at number 53 and the next week it reached its peak at number 38. In Germany, "Summer Love" charted together with "Until the End of Time" and peaked at number 39. It stayed on the chart for nine weeks. The song also reached number 22 on the [[Slovakian Singles Chart]]. ==Track listing== *;CD single and digital download #"Summer Love" – 4:13 #"[[Until the End of Time (Justin Timberlake and Beyoncé Knowles song)|Until the End of Time]]" (duet with [[Beyoncé Knowles|Beyoncé]]) – 5:22 ==Credits and personnel== {{Wikipedia books|FutureSex/LoveSounds}} ;Technical *Recorded and mixed at [[Thomas Crown Studios]] in [[Virginia Beach, Virginia]] ;Personnel * [[Jimmy Douglass|Jimmy Douglas]] – [[Recording engineer|Recording]], [[Mixing (music production)|mixing]] * [[Danja (record producer)|Nate "Danja" Hills]] – Drums, keyboards, production, [[Songwriter|songwriting]] * [[Timothy Mosley|Tim "Timbaland" Mosley]] – Drums, keyboards, mixing, production, songwriting * [[Justin Timberlake]] – [[Background vocals]], keyboards, production, songwriting Credits adapted from the liner notes of ''FutureSex/LoveSounds''.{{cite AV media notes|others=Justin Timberlake|title=[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]|year=2006|type=inlay cover|publisher=[[Jive Records]]|id=8 28768 80622 7|page=19|location=Virginia Beach, Virginia}} ==Charts== {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! Timberlake|rowheader=true|accessdate=May 31, 2012|refname=US RHYTH}} |- |} {{col-2}} ===Year-end charts=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" style="text-align:center;" border="1" |- of 2007: Hot 100 Songs|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|accessdate=June 1, 2012}} |39 |- |} {{col-end}} ==Certifications== {{Certification Table Top}} {{certification Table Amazon Inc|accessdate=May 29, 2012}} |- | rowspan="2"| Digital download | {{cite web|url=http://de.7digital.com/artist/justin-timberlake/release/summer-love-until-the-end-of-time-duet-with-beyonce|title=Summer Love/Until The End Of Tim... - Justin Timberlake - MP3 Musikdownloads - 7digital Deutschland|work=7digital}} |- ! scope="row"| Sweden | December 10, 2007 | {{cite web|url=http://se.7digital.com/artist/justin-timberlake/release/summer-love-until-the-end-of-time-duet-with-beyonce-1|title=Summer Love/Until The End Of Tim... - Justin Timberlake - High Quality Music Downloads - 7digital Sverige|work=7digital}} |- |} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{MetroLyrics song|justin-timberlake|summer-love}} {{Justin Timberlake songs}} {{Good article}} [[Category:2006 songs]] [[Category:2007 singles]] [[Category:Billboard Mainstream Top 40 (Pop Songs) number-one singles]] [[Category:Justin Timberlake songs]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Danja (record producer)]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Timbaland]] [[Category:Songs written by Justin Timberlake]] [[Category:Songs written by Timbaland]] [[Category:Songs written by Danja (record producer)]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Justin Timberlake]]
